definition: New Party (Republic of China)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
party/association/club/society/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Dang

sentences.english: Your Party opposes a rise in the tax, but that did not seem to hurt it.
sentences.chinese: 新黨反對加稅，但是它好像不會去阻撓加稅。

sentences.english: Suu Kyi has expressed dissatisfaction through her lawyer with the formation of the new breakaway party.
sentences.chinese: 昂山素季已經通過律師表達了對新黨的成立的不滿。

sentences.english: In the long term, no doubt, Mr Fini still aspires to the PdL leadership.
sentences.chinese: 從長遠看來，菲尼先生無疑仍希望執掌自由人民新黨。

sentences.english: The new party was born in farming areas of the West and South.
sentences.chinese: 新黨誕生於西部和南部農區。

sentences.english: The Party's New Constitution is the great creed for the new century.
sentences.chinese: 新黨章是新世紀新階段與時俱進的偉大綱領。

sentences.english: The Party Congress also adopted the new Party Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 黨的代表大會還通過了新黨章。

sentences.english: The two groups have merged to form a new party.
sentences.chinese: 兩大組織合併組成一個新黨。

definition: party chief
People First Party, Taiwan
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
Green Standard Army, standing infantry during Qing dynasty, originally formed from Ming and other Chinese army units
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to lift restrictions (such as curfew or martial law)
Eric Chu (1961-), Taiwanese KMT politician
party caucus
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
to hold power/in office
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
ruling party/the party in power
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
to take turns/to work by roster
